intro: Saussurea derbecki, commonly known as the Tibetan yellow gentian, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and robust, branched stems. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Saussurea derbecki is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
